Large Language Models in Emotional Intelligence Tests

This research examined whether large language models can solve and generate performance-based emotional intelligence tests. Results showed that LLMs outperformed humans on five standard emotional intelligence tests, achieving an average accuracy of 81%. The study also found that the original and ChatGPT-generated tests demonstrated statistically equivalent test difficulty, but with some differences in perceived item clarity and realism.

Key Concepts:

  • Emotional Intelligence Tests
  • Performance-Based Testing
  • Natural Language Processing
  • Situational Test of Emotion Understanding
  • Validation Process
  • Emotion Recognition
  • Children's development
  • Emotional similarity in scenarios
  • Rating task
  • Vocabulary test
